Description: Terracotta semi-circular disc with two holes. A thick disc with a barely sunken centre and a broad flat rim, the edge of which is slightly raised; the underside is more roughly finished, with a flattish ’base’; before firing the disc was cut in half and two holes were pierced through the rim near the edge of the cut. Possibly a net weight or loom-weight. Wheel-thrown. Micaceous orange-brown Nile silt.
Curator's comments: Parallel from Naukratis (Oxford, Ashmolean Museum AN1886.519).
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3700)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (TB.38) (Phase 3)
